adjectives.description: downstage (comparative more downstage, superlative most downstage)

entries.meaning: At the front of a stage.

adverbs.description: downstage (comparative more downstage, superlative most downstage)

entries.meaning: Toward or at the front of a theatrical stage.
Towards a motion-picture or television camera.
The part of a stage that is closest to the audience or camera.

verbs.description: downstage (third-person singular simple present downstages, present participle downstaging, simple past and past participle downstaged)

entries.meaning: (medicine, transitive) To restage downward; to restage (a case of a disease, usually a cancer) to a lower stage than that found at last assessment (compare upstage).
